question: What is the average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Mayer Aquarium?
solution: Define adult wolf in Mayer Aquarium as w; so w = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult fox in Mayer Aquarium as e; G = w = 4; so e = 2 * G = 2 * 4 = 8. Define average number of newborn children per adult bear in Mayer Aquarium as A; so A = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Bundle Ranch as X; so X = 2. Define adult bear in Hamilton Farm as d; U = A = 4; so d = 2 + U = 2 + 4 = 6. Define average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Hamilton Farm as H; so H = A = 4. Define adult wolf in Hamilton Farm as k; m = X = 2; so k = 1 + m = 1 + 2 = 3. Define average number of newborn children per adult bear in Hamilton Farm as N; M = e = 8; so N = 3 * M = 3 * 8 = 24. Define total number of newborn animal children in Hamilton Farm as p; a = d * N = 6 * 24 = 144; R = k * H = 3 * 4 = 12; p = a + R = 144 + 12 = 156. Define adult deer in Mayer Aquarium as S; so S = p = 156. Define average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Mayer Aquarium as g; o = S + w = 156 + 4 = 160; so g = o + X = 160 + 2 = 162. Answer: 162.

solution: Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in Mayer Aquarium as Z; so Z = 3. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Jefferson Circus as W; w = Z = 3; so W = 3 + w = 3 + 3 = 6. Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in Hamilton Farm as S; so S = W = 6. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Mayer Aquarium as C; so C = S + W = 6 + 6 = 12. Define average number of newborn children per adult owl in South Zoo as Y; so Y = C - W = 12 - 6 = 6. Define adult owl in South Zoo as j; p = W = 6; so j = 2 + p = 2 + 6 = 8. Define total number of newborn animal children in South Zoo as L; so L = j * Y = 8 * 6 = 48. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Bundle Ranch as M; so M = L = 48. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Bundle Ranch as X; so X = Y = 6. Define adult parrot in Bundle Ranch as y; so y = W = 6. Define adult crow in Bundle Ranch as s; so s = C = 12. Define total number of newborn animal children in Bundle Ranch as N; V = s * M = 12 * 48 = 576; z = y * X = 6 * 6 = 36; N = V + z = 576 + 36 = 612. Answer: 612.

solution: Define average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Maple Creek as P; so P = 2. Define adult racoon in Maple Creek as u; m = P = 2; so u = 2 * m = 2 * 2 = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in Beverly Forest as f; N = p + P = 3 + 2 = 5; t = N + u = 5 + 4 = 9; so f = 3 * t = 3 * 9 = 27. Define adult deer in Pine Ridge as C; h = f + u = 27 + 4 = 31; g = h + P = 31 + 2 = 33; so C = g + p = 33 + 3 = 36. Define average number of newborn children per adult deer in Pine Ridge as w; so w = 3. Define total number of newborn animal children in Pine Ridge as K; so K = C * w = 36 * 3 = 108. Define adult wolf in Maple Creek as U; k = K + w = 108 + 3 = 111; so U = 3 * k = 3 * 111 = 333. Answer: 333.

Define average number of newborn children per adult owl in Beverly Forest as p; Y = w = 3; so p = 2 + Y = 2 + 3 = 5. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Oakridge Riverside as j; E = p = 5; so j = 3 + E = 3 + 5 = 8. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Oakridge Riverside as m; so m = 4. Define adult blue jay in Oakridge Riverside as B; so B = j = 8. Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in Oakridge Riverside as I; y = B = 8; so I = 4 + y = 4 + 8 = 12. Define adult crow in Oakridge Riverside as t; so t = j - p = 8 - 5 = 3. Define adult eagle in Oakridge Riverside as W; so W = w = 3. Define total number of newborn animal children in Oakridge Riverside as Q; q = t * m = 3 * 4 = 12; N = W * I = 3 * 12 = 36; d = B * j = 8 * 8 = 64; a = q + N = 12 + 36 = 48; Q = a + d = 48 + 64 = 112. Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in Pine Ridge as u; Z = Q = 112; so u = 2 * Z = 2 * 112 = 224. Answer: 224.

Define elementary school in Ruby Bay as d; U = A = 4; so d = 2 + U = 2 + 4 = 6. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Ruby Bay as H; so H = A = 4. Define private middle school in Ruby Bay as k; m = X = 2; so k = 1 + m = 1 + 2 = 3. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Ruby Bay as N; M = e = 8; so N = 3 * M = 3 * 8 = 24. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Ruby Bay as p; a = d * N = 6 * 24 = 144; R = k * H = 3 * 4 = 12; p = a + R = 144 + 12 = 156. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Shoreline City as g; o = S + w = 156 + 4 = 160; so g = o + X = 160 + 2 = 162. Answer: 162.

Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Shoreline City as f; C = s = 3; so f = 2 * C = 2 * 3 = 6. Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Shoreline City as K; so K = s = 3. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Shoreline City as v; E = f = 6; so v = 1 + E = 1 + 6 = 7. Define public highschool in Shoreline City as c; so c = v = 7. Define private middle school in Shoreline City as g; e = K = 3; so g = 1 + e = 1 + 3 = 4. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Shoreline City as Z; so Z = c = 7. Define regional medical school in Shoreline City as P; so P = c = 7. Define culinarian school in Shoreline City as N; so N = c = 7. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Shoreline City as p; i = g * v = 4 * 7 = 28; k = N * K = 7 * 3 = 21; U = c * Z = 7 * 7 = 49; d = P * f = 7 * 6 = 42; X = i + k = 28 + 21 = 49; y = X + U = 49 + 49 = 98; p = y + d = 98 + 42 = 140. Answer: 140.

Define upbeat metropolis comedy in Festival de Saint-Rivage as d; U = A = 4; so d = 2 + U = 2 + 4 = 6. Define total number of movie nominations in Festival de Saint-Rivage as p; a = d * N = 6 * 24 = 144; R = k * H = 3 * 4 = 12; p = a + R = 144 + 12 = 156. Define solemn period drama in Cinéma de Montreval as S; so S = p = 156. Define average number of nominations per intense detective thriller in Cinéma de Montreval as g; o = S + w = 156 + 4 = 160; so g = o + X = 160 + 2 = 162. Answer: 162.

question: How many regional medical school does Glenfield City have?
solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define culinarian school in Glenfield City as l; so l = 3. Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Glenfield City as P; so P = l = 3. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Glenfield City as T; so T = 3. Define regional medical school in Glenfield City as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Glenfield City as Q; D = x * T = (x) * (3) = 3*x; Z = l * P = (3) * (3) = 9; Q = D + Z = 3*x + 9 = 3*x + 9. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Hawkesbury as K; so K = Q - x = (3*x + 9) - (x) = 2*x + 9. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Evervale City as s; so s = l = 3. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Evervale City as j; N = K = 2*x + 9; so j = 2 * N = (2) * (2*x + 9) = 4*x + 18. Define regional medical school in Evervale City as p; A = P = 3; so p = 1 + A = 1 + 3 = 4. Define elementary school in Evervale City as d; so d = P = 3. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Evervale City as v; y = d * s = (3) * (3) = 9; o = p * j = (4) * (4*x + 18) = 16*x + 72; v = y + o = 9 + 16*x + 72 = 16*x + 81. We know v = 145, so we have 16*x + 81 = 145 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 16*x + 81 = 145. Move all terms to one side: 16*x - 64 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 16*x = 64. Divide both sides by 16: x = 64 / 16. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Westhaven City as D; so D = 3. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Westhaven City as p; g = D = 3; so p = 4 * g = (4) * (3) = 12. Define private middle school in Westhaven City as S; h = p = 12; so S = 3 + h = 3 + 12 = 15. Define public highschool in Westhaven City as W; C = S + p = 15 + 12 = 27; so W = 4 + C = 4 + 27 = 31. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Hawkesbury as Z; so Z = p = 12. Define public highschool in Hawkesbury as A; so A = W + Z = 31 + 12 = 43. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Brightford as w; T = Z = 12; so w = 1 + T = 1 + 12 = 13. Define private middle school in Hawkesbury as O; Q = w = 13; so O = 4 * Q = (4) * (13) = 52. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Hawkesbury as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Hawkesbury as q; U = O * x = (52) * (x) = 52*x; j = A * Z = (43) * (12) = 516; q = U + j = 52*x + 516 = 52*x + 516. We know q = 568, so we have 52*x + 516 = 568 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 52*x + 516 = 568. Move all terms to one side: 52*x - 52 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 52*x = 52. Divide both sides by 52: x = 52 / 52. Solution: x = 1. Answer: 1.
